question:
Consider the following statements about the Deen Dayal Upadhyaya Grameen Kaushalya Yojana (DDU-GKY):
  1. It is a part of the National Rural Livelihood Mission (NRLM).
  2. It is a demand-driven placement-linked skill training initiative by the Ministry of Skill Development and Entrepreneurship
  3. The minimum salary assured once recruited after training provided under the scheme is Rs. 6000 per month.
Which of the above statements is/are correct?
explanation: Deen Dayal Upadhyaya Grameen Kaushalya Yojana (DDU-GKY) is a Government of India youth employment scheme. It was launched on 25 September 2014 by Union Ministers Nitin Gadkari and Venkaiah Naidu on the occasion of the 98th birth anniversary of Pandit Deendayal Upadhyaya. <u>First statement is correct</u>. The scheme is a part of National Rural Livelihood Mission (NRLM). <u>Second statement is incorrect</u>. The scheme is not an initiative by Ministry of Skill Development And Entrepreneurship but by Ministry of Rural Development. <u>Third statement is correct</u>. As per the rules, the minimum package offered once trained under DDU-GKY and placed is Rs 6000/ per month. The training partners are mandated to place at-least 75% of the successful candidates in jobs.
